reviewText:
i give this a yes because this game is really good. there are few things wrong.
Cons.
A) in battle your companions continuosly say the same 3 peices of dialouge all the time.
B) the epic music in battle is comtinuously interupted by the enemy turn so fast you get auditory whiplash. seroiusly just have one piece playing through the battle and randomize what piece it is for the battles unless the music is important for asthetics in the battle.
C) SPOILER the scene where fontain says arcadius is not the real arcadius was to soon and quickly just whisked away. i would have prefered he hinted at it or something to make you think he isn't the real arcadius but also still think he is because of what the crew says. that would have been better.
Pros
A) the music is flipping amazing. i would expect that if this was a movie this would be the music playing.
B) each character has a fleshed out personality. they are all diffrent whis allows you to pick and choose your favorites (personally i love sola and chigara)
C) the most of the choices actually feel hard to do. the story is so gripping that you actually feel responsible if you make a choice that accidently gets 600 kids killed. but it also makes you feel happy you made the right choice when consuling a crew member who is feeling down.
D) none of the crew is in instant love with you (except 1) which means you have to make the right choices inorder to get the relationship you want. i like this idea and i wish more visual novels with romance did this.
E) the battles are HARD. i mean by the gods i had times where i wanted to punch my computer. going all out does not work. it willonly get yo so far until your main ship is surrounded by battlecruisers and you can't do anything but die. i like it though because it makes me have to think everything through to the last detail.
All in all i give this game a 9/10. if it wasn't for the few flaws this would have been perfect but not everyone is perfect so i applaud the creators and i hope they relase more free pieces of art on steam.

reviewText:
A game that got kickstarted, and is then available for free, with absolutely no catches.

Sunrider is basically a Visual Novel x SRPG erogame, with solid gameplay in this genre. The steam vanilla version has removed certain you-know-what scenes so the ero aspect has tuned down if that worries you.

At the end of the day, if the theme of the game interests you and you would like some real gameplay happening, this is one of the games that you should absoultely give it a try, as we don't even usually get these types of games made anymore these days.

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed playing through Sunrider: First Arrival and now Mask of Arcadius. I'm always a sucker for stories with anime girls, space ships, and giant robots, and I found this one to be thoroughly enjoyable. The story is pretty good, especially for a free Visual Novel! I found myself drawn in from the very start, and I wondered how my decisions would affect the outcomes! Your decisions can truly make a difference in the direction the story takes, I think (I've only seen how they affect things a couple of different ways). And I was actually a bit surprised at how dark the story got in places. As for the strategic battle sections, I found them to be quite fun. As the game progresses, the missions get quite difficult! I had to lower the difficulty setting from normal (Captain as of the Mask of Arcadius update) to get through the game! And even then, figuring out the best strategy wasn't easy
date: especially in the later missions. All in all, definitely worth a playthrough. And if strategy isn't your thing, you can even play on Visual Novel" mode so that the battles are nearly impossible to lose.\nThe only complaint I have
recommended: is that since it is still in Beta
hoursPlayed: the bugs haven't been totally worked out yet
voteText: and you may end up running into some points where the game crashes. But it's free

reviewText: Mask of arcadius is a great update and expands the story, new side missions, but less choices. You will not have any meaningful choices in this campaign where as first arrival had multiple meaningful choices or seemingly meaningful choices. I had a major problem with crashes on my pc and framerate issues. A problem that needs to be addressed is the spawning spam that enemies use: certain missions have carriers that can spawn ryders that will be able to attack that turn and if the carriers are not attacked and destroyed right away you will fail because they will spawn infinite ryders. I faied a mission because the carriers had spawned 6 support units on top of the 2 they already had which meant they turned off the flak on all of my units as well as using disable on my sniper and heavy kinetic units which made the carriers impossible to kill. There is still so much work to be done on this game but as of right now it is solid and free leaving no reason for you to download it.

reviewText:
If this was a 5€ game, it would be worth it. If this was a 2.50€ game, it would be a must buy. Being free, there is no reason not to play it. It will only cost you 10+ hours of gameplay, and it's worth every one of them.

There's no sex and only one nude picture. If you are searching for porn, you won't find it here, but you'll get a pretty good visual novel. And free.

Now to the game itself:
There are two aspects of the game, the visual novel aspect and the strategy one. In both cases the game does some things incredibly well and others... not so well.


First, the game as a visual novel.

The story is quite good. It's not the best plot I've ever seen (in fact, it's pretty linear) but it works, and it's interesting enough to keep you playing.

The characters are outstanding and well made. They may be the typical anime characters (the shy one, the serious one, the one who hides her feelings, the joyful one, etc) but they never feel plain nor boring.

The diferent choices you can make are interesting. It's not just the overused are you a good or bad guy?". There are some tough decisions to be made. The downside part to this is that this choices have no impact on the story... for now. The only real choices you make is taking the side mission A or B
date: but this does not affect the ending or the storyline. However
recommended: this may be changed. Or at least
hoursPlayed:
I hope so.


Now
voteText: lets talk about the game as a strategy game.\n\nYou play on a hexagonal grid
helpfulPercent: giving orders to your units and taking turns. There's a good variaty on units
votesHelpful: and the game is quite challenging. You need to know how to use your different units to achieve victory. Or
votesTotal: altenatively
votesFunny: you can take down the difficulty level
commentsCount: if you are just interested in the story of the game.\n\nThere's also the option to upgrade your units

I'd like to mention that the soundtarck is outstanding and really enhances the game. The artwork is also really good.

Overall

reviewText:
My Captain Shield was emotionally unstable yet I found myself with a satisfying ending. GG WM (Well Made). 5/5

^ and that is the tl;dr of my review.

Combat (Captain Mode) 5/5

Captain mode is the Normal mode for this game. Out of 2 playthroughs (twice thru the 1st arc, and once thru the second arc), I can say I had no great issues. The last fight in the 1st arc was a fun challenge. Gameplay changes quite a lot depending on your unit investments (you spend cash earnt from scrapping enemies on weapon damage, accuracy, energy usage, HP, EP, and more). I usually set up my ship to fire two rounds of kinetics per turn. In the second arc, there are two battles which will feel impossible (and will be if you don't have the support units for it). The 1st difficult fight (in the second arc) is one of the three side missions. Do the other two first to rack in the cash. Then you can beat this side mission with enough game knowledge. The second hard mission, is just that there are TOO MANY ENEMIES! I mean seriously, TOO MANY ENEMIES JUST TO AMBUSH ONE CARGO SHIP! I WANT TO KNOW WHAT IS IN THAT BLOODY SHIP! Honestly though, the combat is fun. There are also 6 difficulty options that you can change in game, so if you get stuck on a mission, you have an easy way out. Or if it's to easy for the master tactician, then you can go be a flippin' space whale.

Characters - 4.5/5

Potential Waifus are all great. If you aren't happy with any of them, ask for a refun- Oh wait, it's free. Free Waifu is good Waifu.
Seriously though, from justice loving, to perverted, to tsundere, to childhood friend, to shy, to patriot, and all the way to I only live to fight"; You have a large variety of waifu candidates.

Story - 4.5/5

*Prologue Spoilers*

You're a Captain who's just minding your own business

Style - 5/5

reviewText:
I normally don't write out reviews (and I'm sure it'll show) but I cannot leave this game to go onto other without trying to get others to see if they'd like to experience what I did. So here it goes, ahem....

Sunrider is a storybook game with simplistic strategy elements, if you've ever wanted to play out a Space Mecha Anime now's your chance.

The story is the highpoint of the game. Taking you from one point to another as the captain of a new starship that's been expelled from its homeland. The plots twists and turns between the moral dilemmas you must navigate. Do you stop the slave traders whole will be vulnerable for a limited amount of time and free innocents? Or do you attack an outpost of the enemy that attacked your home world that will be ripe for an assault before the relief fleet can arrive? This is one of many choices you will have to make, weighing in your fight against the enemy, the morality of your choices, and how your crew may become enraptured or disillusioned in the struggle based on the decisions you make. This makes them hard to make and that's a good thing.

The characters are one dimensional at first, fitting into their respective tropes and cliches. You've got the by-the-books First Officer, the ditzy and childish ace pilot, the shy and reclusive tech genious, and so on. Over time though the characters grow and overcome their mistakes and past demons. I personally found myself looking forward to each chapter to not only see where the story was going (and believe me it hits you hard at times) but how the characters would react to it. It really brought a new dimension to the game that I found extraordinary for the FTP indie game.

The gameplay when it comes to space combat is simple at first: you have weapons and defenses, some are better at taking out certain units than others and so on. With every new chapter you get introduced to a new element added into the gameplay; new weapons, defense systems, units, scenarios, and an ever increasing (to the point of classic Nintendo level frustration at times) keep the combat relatively fresh and interesting. I will have to say that I found it to be the weakest factor of the game, due to lag in the combat system itself (though Python isn't known for being the smoothest of code when run, it's still a factor) and the voice work, while not bad at all for semi-professional or amateur work can become repetitive due to the repetitive nature of the gameplay.

Last thing I want to mention is the soundtrack. It's gorgeous. I don't know of another way to put it. Each track fits the scene you need. Is the game trying to stress the struggle in life and death combat? Here's a score that gets your blood flowing. Need to make it a solemn and tormenting moment within the ever cracking psyche of a character? Have a eery and sorrowful piano arrangement. Need to emphasize just how ridiculous and lighthearted a scene is when your perverted doctor tries to give one of her exams" to your character? Welp here's something to draws you out of the first 2 and into the new scene. It's a stellar job and a soundtrack I'll listen to outside of the game.

Overall it's a stellar game for a FTP and an unexpected jewel that I'm glad I found. The artwork is gorgeous and really fits the space opera/mecha feel it's got going for it. It'd recommend this to anyone fans of these themes and to those who enjoy a good sci-fi story with a range of silly and dark topics.

WARNING: There are a few scenes that are adult themed
date: and while they're few and far in between they might put some people off (though the fact that there's war an genocide is totally nothing to worry about /s)\n\n9/10 would bang my keyboard in frustration at the combat and have the story force me to feel such potent feels again."

reviewText:
Oh, Sunrider...

I want to like you. I truly do - you've got a semi-decent battle section, and I'm a sucker for sci-fi settings. But I can't. Why?

Its too cliche.

Now, I know, this is a free game, and I'm not expecting Mass Effect; plus, pretty much everything has one or more cliches in it. The whole attacked-on-the-first-day thing, for example, I can ignore. What I'm talking about are the anime cliches - they're simply too much.

First off, we've got the situation that Shields' childhood friend is the first mate. Yeah, okay, we can be flexible with our disbelief and let that pass, but its still pretty contrived.

Next, tying sort of into the above, there's girls everywhere yet no man in sight beyond the captain himself, like a harem show or game. Nothing can justify this; even games like Tokimeki have the male best friend" character.

Adding to that
date: the uniforms. First Mate Aya wears a uniform that's believably military
hoursPlayed: even if his has buckles all over the place. Virtually all the other characters? High school uniforms. Yes
voteText: folks
helpfulPercent:
you heard that right - a stereotypical anime high school uniform on board of a starship.

Do I even need to go over mecha in this game? There's literally no reason for it to exist; even their combat weaponry are pretty much replacable by the in-game enemy missile frigate and bomber!

Last but not least
votesHelpful: I've got a major complaint about the characters overall; they're incredibly one dimensional
votesTotal: to the point where you can explain their entire personality in a few words. Such as
votesFunny: "childhood friend
commentsCount: not!Rei Ayanami
column16: etc. You can't connect at all to the characters, because they have nothing unique to connect to.\n\nHonestly, these anime cliches and the space opera setting mix together about as well as oil and water, which is a shame because it would be excellent otherwise, especially for a freeware VN. Something I'd like to point out here though, is that visual novels are just another form of gaming/entertainment - you don't have to use cliches from the animus or mangos to make it, or even do it in an animesque style! This was probably designed to attract a certain group of people, and considering the amount of positive reviews, it did it well, but in the end there is a ton of wasted potential, which could have opened it up to a larger audience.

reviewText:
My review to help improve the game from the standpiont.

Storywriting. The characters are pretty good, I mean they have their tropes but that's to be expected somewhat in Anime. As long as they are unique in the end it's somewhat good. The writting here is mediocre, it's there and it is like a tool. It achieve's it's purpose. The overall story is creative, but harder to emerse yourself in the overall universe. It's hard to believe the beginning the corny start.  Now it's a lot better then many other stories out there, mind you. It's not completely horrible. Some of the characters have completely compeling stories. 2.5/5

The gameplay. The gameplay is pretty good, the gae has a strong strategy element. It may need a few quirks here or there. 4/5

Bugs. THere are a couple of bugs, which make the game hard to play especially if your computer is lagging. It doesn't have a lot of lag, unless your computer heats up. Which is not because of the game. It's because of Windows 7 getting old. Anyway the game itself has some errors clicking and sometimes the links don't work. Using a mouse in this game can be awkward so use your trackpad in bootcamp. 3/5 (It's not like they ruin it's more like a nusiance.

Audio. I will admit the lines in the story can get old, you can tell they have some of the same actors. Those actors are pretty talented, and it's nice that they have audio! Having a few more would be nice. I also think the music can get repetative, it's something of a fine line. I like the music as it contributes to the overal story. 4/5

Some of the visual graphics actually create more appealing characters and the scripting of the storyboard is highly sophisticated for a visual novel. Whoever made this understands how to position the characters at the right time. The character designs are perfectly creative and unique, the style is new and fresh unlike some styles which after awhile the manga/anime start to copy because of it's favorite in a genre. This cuts that red tape. 4/5

Minor irritations and alpha/beta edits. The explosions need to be automatic or a video, it's irritating to click and see the same explosion for the same hit everytime. I also have issues with this because you might press the wrong button if it freezes with bootcamp or a older computer.  it would also be nice to implement critical hits into the game but that's another issue for another day. This game needs some extra cash flow somehow. It also would be nice if the story could progress into more side missions which could be released later. 3.5/5

Morality - pshychology invoking/rhetorical questions. The overal story's idea of making you you doesn't seem to fit the story.  For some reason you are outside watching all of this going on. The story needs some additional character backbone to create a fulfilling element for a visual novel. There's no urgency to the story, or actual reason. In some ways that can be a draw because you know Hey I'm just exploring the universe." I miss a lot of things like the space genre

reviewText:
There are not many Science fiction Mech games out there.

I played this game on my Linux computer for about 10 hours and its fun.
Every character has it's own personality and way they do things. That causes funny and arkward situations on the spaceship. Music is good, it's suits the game very well. The drawings are nice. The mechs look good and have several small animations. Due to money constrains they could not add more, cause it has been funded by Kickstarter. Althought low budget the game does not feel cheap, but nice en enjoyable to play. The battles require some tactics, it's not just do something and you will win. The mechs and ship can be upgraded with the spoils of war, the money you gain from destroying enemies. During the conversations and actions between enemies and friends you can choose what to say.

One remark: It would have been great if they chose to implement the basegame as 12 years old and the 18+ as an upgrade. There is an uncensor option somewhere on their website....

Overall a good game. Thanks to Kickstarter, it has become totally free on Steam!
Thank you people who saw this game on Kickstarter and payed for it!

reviewText: Sunrider is a visual novel/tactics hybrid that happens to have a lot of potential in the latter category. The difficulty curve spikes wildly and it's very easy to make the game unwinnable without dropping difficulty levels, since there are very few battles to gain money and too many ways to spend it for such a short game. I'm not sure that the upcoming final part will improve on this, but even so the tactical aspects are quite fun to play.\n\nSo why don't I recommend it? To put it bluntly, even by VN standards the writing for this game is truly awful. The plot is composed of every cliche the writers could think of, characters in their late twenties still don't seem more mature that middle schoolers, and the technical writing is also poor. There's a lot of potential here if a quality writer could get a look at it, but as is I can't recommend it, let alone the dating sim that, from the PV, is just as poorly written but without the interesting gameplay.

reviewText: If you miss out on this while it's free, you're a sucker. This is the best space fantasy anime parody I've ever played. The story holds up on it's own, though the dialogue needs some polish. The gameplay is fantastic and the characters are lovable. The music is excellent and the visuals are very impressive. This is all very well put together, and is definitely a perfect proof of concept for a full 50 dollar title. Someone should invest in this post-haste. Did I mention the intro is *sicker than sickness*??? I'm gonna stop before I lose my fanboy panties.\n\n10 out of 10. Play Sunrider.

reviewText: This is a good game for people who like graphic novels and also for some strategy gamers. This is a good graphic novel, the storyline is engaging for anyone who likes sci-fi, futuristic settings, etc. 10/10 for that part. I know the strategy part is probably more of a background thing for the game, but the animations aren't actual animations, its just moving around and sometimes just near damn impossible. Just a bit of advice for future downloaders, try the game. You have nothing to lose, but I still think the strategy part of the game could be improved. 6/10 for the strategy part. Overall, 8.5/10.

reviewText:
Half of Sunrider is great, half of it is good, and neither half is compleatly finished yet. The art in the visual novel half is good with the standard anime look but it clashes with the art of the space battles, which although interesting and detailed, are done is a compleatly different style.

The visual novel half of sunrider is great with interesting characters and a well told story. However the story is only about 2/3 done and ends on a cliffhanger so if that bothers you perhaps it would be better to wait until the story is compleatly finished sometime this year.

The turn based strategy game half is good but slight balence problems. Battles are strategic and interesting with good weapon variety and challenging battles. The assets used are interesting to look at but audio barks are limited and enemy variety is limited. The game is very difficult, which although mitigated by the difficulty options in the beginning, occationally feels a bit unfair especially in the escort missions.

reviewText:
A surpringly well crafted game that is much more in line with Mass Effect than a space opera visual novel.  Dialog is all well written with many (somewhat cliched) unique characters and interactions.  Main character is not a lout, which is a plus, and while nearly every other character is a girl, only a few are actively throwing themselves at you, and for the most part the main character is too involved in the main plot of them game (which follows a Battlestar Galactica-type story but less grim yet still compelling).

Art is good enough to not be distracting, and the non-dialog driven gameplay is pleasant enough. It is a hex-based strategy game but far less complicated than a Final Fantasy Tactics and generally focuses on shorter battles.  I find it not at all frustrating, but I'm playing one of the easier of the five (!) available difficulties.

And it's free!  (Well, it was Kickstarted.) Who can argue with that?  Though the quality of this game has encouraged me to purchase the less-free Sunrider Academy, so as an advertising campaign it is also quite successful.  Give it a try!  If you like Mass Effect you owe yourself a go with Sunrider.

reviewText:
For a free visual novel game it offers a lot.It has a weird/interesting story with a strategic battling system which I quite enjoyed.The story and story are kinda similiar to Mass Effect but instead of having aliens as teammates here you have anime girls that ride cool mechs.

Pros:
+Interesting battling system
+Mass effect-ish
+A variety of characters
+Dark plot twists
+Michael Bay directed explosions (the death sound of the enemys is soo satysfying)

Cons:
-The upgrades you choose in harder difficulties are crucial to success and there aren't many ways of gathering money than just destroying all the enemies and doing the few side missions
-No way of reseting certain actions during combat than just fully restarting the whole turn (the times I fired missiles instead of using the kinetic weapon and had to restart...)

Mixed:
/Ecchi/nude scenes (you are either gonna like or dislike these)
/Standard anime crap that is seen in every other existing anime (stereotypical characters and the inevitabile beach scene...)

Overall for a free game it is a pretty solid game.Hopefully the confirmed sequel will be even better :)
